title: All ‘Pilgrimage’ wayshrine locations in Oblivion Remastered
description: “Pilgrimage” is a side quest in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered that requires you to look for nine shrines across the map to pray at. author: George Yang
categories: The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered guides
excerpt: Where to find all nine wayshrines

html:
“Pilgrimage” is a side quest in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered that requires you to look for nine shrines across the map to pray at. Praying at these shrines will help determine if you’re worthy of becoming a knight.

While this quest doesn’t have any rewards, it opens up several other future ones, including “The Shrine of the Crusader” and “Wisdom of the Ages.” Each shrine also increases certain attributes, meaning that you’ll become stronger at the end of this quest.

This Oblivion Remastered guide includes a full “Pilgrimage” walkthrough, including where to start the quest, where to find all nine wayshrines, what bonuses you’ll get from them, and what happens at the end when you finish praying at each shrine.

Table of Contents

  • ‘Pilgrimage’ quest walkthrough in Oblivion Remastered
  • All wayshrines in ‘Pilgrimage’ in Oblivion Remastered

‘Pilgrimage’ quest walkthrough in Oblivion Remastered

Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Fast travel to Anvil Castle. On your right, you should see a prophet — a white-haired old man yelling about some hysterical prophecy.

Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Talk to the prophet and ask him about the attack on the chapel. Keep mentioning the chapel and then he’ll say something about Relics. Offer to find the Relics and make sure to say, “No. I have no claim to fame” when he asks you if you’re a worthy knight.

Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

He’ll then ask you to pray at nine Wayshrines, which will cause something magical will happen. The wayshrines are surrounded by columns. All you simply have to do is interact with the shrine and a pop-up will appear with some flavor text. Oh, and it’ll boost one of your attributes.

Once you interact with the last shrine, Penlinal Whitestrake will automatically show up in a vision and speak to you. This will then unlock “The Shrine of the Crusader” quest and complete “Pilgrimage.”

All wayshrines in ‘Pilgrimage’ in Oblivion Remastered

Graphic: Polygon | Source image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Above, see a map of all nine wayshrines in Oblivion Remastered and where to find them, followed by a table below detailing what attributes you’ll get a boost from for each wayshrine.

Wayshrine

Attribute Bonus

Akatosh+10 Speed and Magicka
Arkay+10 Health
Dibella+10 Personality
Julianos+10 Intelligence and Magicka
Kynareth+10 Agility
Mara+10 Willpower
Stendarr+10 Endurance
Talos+10 Strength
Zenithat+10 Luck

Below, we’ll show you more details about where to find each wayshrine for “Pilgrimage” in Oblivion Remastered.

Wayshrine of Akatosh

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: south of Bruma, close to Orange Road
Attribute: +10 Speed and Magicka

Wayshrine of Arkay

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: slightly northeast of Anvil
Attribute: +10 Health

Wayshrine of Dibella

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: south of Chorrol
Attribute: +10 Personality

Wayshrine of Julianos

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: southeast of the Imperial City, along the Yellow Road
Attribute: +10 Intelligence and Magicka

Wayshrine of Kynareth

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: north of Silverfish River
Attribute: +10 Agility

Wayshrine of Mara

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: west of Skingrad
Attribute: +10 Willpower

Wayshrine of Stendarr

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: north of Leyawiin
Attribute: +10 Endurance

Wayshrine of Talos

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: north of Bravil, above the Green Road and along the Nibenay Valley
Attribute: +10 Stength

Wayshrine of Zenithar

1/2Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks via Polygon

Location: north of Bravil, close to the Flooded Mine
Attribute: +10 Luck

For more Oblivion Remastered guides, see our running lists of all factions and followers.
